first_section.heading: Transition Quality Empowerment Project (TQEP)
first_section.content:
Your Voice. Your Story. Your Future.

Young people disabilities, their families, and transition stakeholders together make up the ultimate network of “know-how” on what works in planning and reaching goals for life after high school! In TQEP, young people, families and stakeholders uncover effective transition practices, programs and opportunities, dream about what could be and make a detailed community-wide action plan to achieve them.

  • Funded and supported by the PA Developmental Disabilities Council
  • Builds upon research that created the Transition Discoveries Framework and Infographic Guide
  • Follows a step-by-step community-led and data-driven action planning model

second_section.heading: The Core Components of TQEP
second_section.subheading: Building local capacity through collaborative learning and shared leadership

points.heading: Learning Experiences
points.description: Young people and families learning together about planning for success after high school and throughout life through workshops online and in-person

points.heading: Elevating Voices
points.description: Using the Transition Discoveries Quality Indicator Survey Metric (TDQI) to highlight “what works” and what can be improved in transition through local collaboration

points.heading: Youth Leadership
points.description: Young people with disabilities joining together in order to participate in advocacy, service learning projects and mentorship

points.heading: Data-Driven Community Action
points.description: Establishing Transition Change Agent Teams (T-CATs) of young people, families and stakeholders who lead community-action plans to improve transition

third_section.heading: Project Outcomes
third_section.subheading: A community-driven model of designing and continuously improving transition practices and opportunities for all young people and their families
third_section.content:
When communities of young people with disabilities, families and stakeholders join together in implementing the TQEP

  • Knowledge and decision making about what’s working in transition and what can be improved is shared between all community members
  • Data-driven decision making evolves from compliance to being response to the strengths, goals and needs of the community
  • Youth-led, youth-driven programs are developed and expanded
  • Links are strengthened between school and community to prepare for success after high school
  • Partners collaborate to design new opportunities for preparing for work, more school or training after high school and living independently

testimonialList.title: Warrior Run School District
testimonialList.description: “TQEP has helped the Warrior Run School District grow our transition program despite the barriers of our rural setting.  Our community, staff and students are grateful for the opportunity we have been given and we look forward to sharing our successes with other districts.”

testimonialList.title: Berks County Transition Coordinating Council
testimonialList.description: “What TQEP has provided the council is valuable resources and information that youth need to be successful in life. The things we learned and continue to learn throughout this process will indeed help youth in Berks County and beyond for years to come.”

testimonialList.title: Pittsburgh Public Schools
testimonialList.description: “The Pittsburgh Public Schools' partnership with TQEP has provided guidance and opportunities to promote youth leadership and family engagement activities, as well as created a framework that will allow us to take an introspective look at current practices. Through this work, we will continue to grow and expand transition services in the District.”

testimonialList.title: Berks County Transition Coordinating Council
testimonialList.description: “TQEP has provided Berks Transition Coordinating Council with data that is extremely valuable in planning to develop new and improve existing transition services and practices to benefit Berks County students, young adults and families.”

testimonialList.title: Warrior Run School District
testimonialList.description: “Warrior Run is thankful to have been chosen to participate in this TQEP project.  We value the feedback we have received and strive to improve the educational/social-emotional opportunities for our students.  We look forward to continuing to work in these partnerships with the goal of increasing the impact of the voices from our youth.”

fifth_section.heading: Advisory Board Members
